User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: 3.1.7

Having few accounts configured, each account has few folders in some of them th're unread emails (mail1,mail4, mail21)
Acc1
   folder1
      mail1
   folder2
   folder3
   folder4
      mail4
Acc2
   folder1
      mail21

When a popup is displayed with information about new messages and I click on one message from Acc1/folder4, it gets displayed.
Then when pressed N (Go/Next/Unread Message) It asks if I want to jump to Unread message in Acc2/folder1. There's no way of direct jumping to unread mail (mail1) for the same account in folder1 using just a keyboard.

I seem to remember it used to check first for unread emails for the same account. Key P - searches just in current folder

It's annoying especially when you have many accounts like newsgroups.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Create a structure of two accounts and multiple folder in each of them
Acc1
   folder1
      mail1
   folder2
   folder3
   folder4
      mail4
Acc2
   folder1
      mail21
2. select unread message (mail4) in folder4 of account Acc1
5. press N (next unread message).
Actual Results:  
MessageBox is displayed with question if you want to jump to next unread message in folder folder1 of Acc2.
It's not checking for unread messages in the same account.


Expected Results:  
Goes to unread message in Acc1/folder1/mail1

Key (Go/Previous/Unread Message) works in curren folder only.
